definition: to be put to a lot of trouble
to get dragged into/to get involved (on sb else's account)
to receive/to accept/to suffer/subjected to/to bear/to stand/pleasant/(passive marker)
tired/weary/to strain/to wear out/to work hard
to accumulate/to involve or implicate (Taiwan pr. [lei4])/continuous/repeated

sentences.english: These are most frequently seen in the frontal and parietal bones with the orbital and maxillofacial bones infrequently involved.
sentences.chinese: 最常见于额骨和顶骨，眶骨和上颌骨很少受累。

sentences.english: The pathogenesis of this multicentric disorder may be associated with autoimmune disease.
sentences.chinese: 它的多器官受累可能与自身免疫疾病的发病机制相似。

sentences.english: Lateral groups of nephrons are affected more than central ones, leading to patchy atrophy with variable degrees of severity.
sentences.chinese: 受累较中央组为重，而导致严重程度不等的斑状萎缩。

sentences.english: Seven of the 8 presented with right renal involvement.
In all these lesions with downward extension, the red nucleus was always spared.
sentences.chinese: 当病灶向下延伸时，红核常不受累。

sentences.english: Note the purplish blue calcifications in the media; note that the lumen is unaffected by this process.
sentences.chinese: 在动脉中膜可见紫蓝色的钙化灶，而管腔没有受累。

sentences.english: Some steps may help lighten the affected areas of your skin.
sentences.chinese: 有一些措施能够改善皮肤受累区域的色泽。

sentences.english: Know autumn eventually is see not get oneself lord the son implicate, the openings advises a way.
sentences.chinese: 知秋终是见不得自家主子受累，开口劝道。

sentences.english: The site and the blood vessel mostly to be involved were basal nucleus and vertebral artery.
sentences.chinese: 脑受累部位以基底核偏多，受累血管多为椎动脉。

sentences.english: The site and the blood vessel mostly to be involved were basal nucleus and vertebral artery.
sentences.chinese: 脑受累部位以基底核偏多，受累血管多为椎动脉。

sentences.english: China still suffers from its reputation of being a copycat manufacturer.
sentences.chinese: 中国仍然受累于“山寨”仿造品制造者的声誉。

sentences.english: Howeer, the 2 uppermost disc spaces were still proportionally less affected.
sentences.chinese: 尽管如此，最上的2个椎间盘仍然相对较少受累。

sentences.english: He has a disease that afflicts the motor functions of his body.
sentences.chinese: 他的疾病，使得他身体肌肉运动的机能受累了。

sentences.english: There is no firm evidence to guide the management of major vessel disease in BD.
sentences.chinese: 尚无肯定证据来指导白塞病大血管受累的治疗。

sentences.english: However, the 2 uppermost disc spaces were still proportionally less affected.
sentences.chinese: 尽管如此，最上的2个椎间盘仍然相对较少受累。

sentences.english: Pathologically, all layers of the respiratory bronchiole walls were involved.
sentences.chinese: 病理形态特点是呼吸性细支气管全层受累。

definition: to endure/to suffer/hardships/torments/a hard time/a nuisance
to live comfortably/happy and prosperous life
to tax one's mind and body/demanding (work)/dedicated (worker)/hard-working
to encumber/to be a burden on/to implicate
to work with one's brains/to rack one's brains/to worry
erhua variant of 幹活|干活[gan4 huo2]
